website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight floating hammock that has a couple of features that other brands do not include.
pros: This water hammock has more of a lounger design, which allows for the inclusion of clips so you can tether yourself to a dock, a boat, or other floating hammocks
The unit folds flat for easy storage and your purchase includes a convenient carrying bag
cons: After inflating, it can be tricky to reinsert the air-plug without loosing too much air

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! When the Dog allows me to
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! When the Dog allows me to, I love it. Very well made. I have 4 large dogs that have climbed over it and pawed it out of the way and as you can see from the picture loves climbing on It and laying down but, It has no hole yet. Easy to get on and It keeps you in the water just enough to stay cool.
customer_reviews.author: Loly

customer_reviews.title: and we love it. I wish I could return this
customer_reviews.text: I think they should call this the "Water Taco". If you weigh more than 100 pounds, this thing folds up on you. It was given as a Christmas gift and then we waited to use it until it was warm enough. It is a complete disaster. I got the other product that is more of a chair from the same manufacturer, and we love it. I wish I could return this.
customer_reviews.author: Chadillac

customer_reviews.title: Its tall enough for a person thats maybe 5, 4 and holds up well
customer_reviews.text: I like this pool hammock its the right lenght for me and would even be good for a taller person , its very comfortable it xoes a good job of keeping me just above the water( except since its a hammock of course my back and a little of my stomach go in the water) so keeps me cool, i really love it but i gave 4 stars because for some reason idk why but the pillow part soaks in alot of water and it does take a few hours to drain out, it doesn't sink. , it just seeps in water but other than that its a good price and i like it
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Seay

customer_reviews.title: A must!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to feel comfortable 31 weeks pregnant with triplets. I love how I can take this very easily to the pool because it folds up small and takes one breath to blow up!
customer_reviews.author: tripmom

customer_reviews.title: done before 2 years
customer_reviews.text: purchased 2 of these aug 2018. were great for 2 years, but blew a hole this year right at the cup holder . . . the first inflation of the year. no way to patch either, as the "bladder" is sewed into the inside. these were protected over the years and never beat up or anything. for this price, i woulda hoped for this to last a LOT longer. haven't tried blowing up the other one yet, but not holding out any hopes for it . . . pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: arthropod98

customer_reviews.title: Nice relaxing, well designed float.
customer_reviews.text: This is not like a common air mattress. A common air mattress keeps your body above the water line, typically. This mattress keeps your body in the water line and your head is kept above the water line with the pillow. It's a matter of your wants. A bonus with this mattress is that it's easier to blow up. Just the edges and pillow hold air. I believe this is more comfortable than a basic air mattress. The aired up edges are a cloth covered material as opposed to balloon like air mattresses.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Lone Star

customer_reviews.title: Mesh Rips easy
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the float two times and the mesh is starting to rip between the holes. The design doesn't make sense if it rips that easy. Wish I could send it back.
customer_reviews.author: LISA GILBERT

customer_reviews.title: Durable!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered MANY of these for family members. We vacation at a place with a lazy river and float comfortably all day every day. The fabric edges get ripped up because of the rocky walls (it’s super rough in there) BUT we spend hours a day doing this. It’s totally normal wear because of what we do AND they still stay inflated! I’m amazed. We haven’t had one pop on us yet! We’re only down one because it was stolen. They are incredibly comfortable too. You can definitely (and most likely will) take a snooze in it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Bialek

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold air
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great product, if it held air. It's nice to be able to float while still being in the water, and it needs minimal air to blow it up - no pump needed. The issue is the valve - they don't have a trap on them that holds the air in. The instructions say to blow up the tube and then use your finger to hold the air in until you can close the valve, but since it only takes 3-4 breaths to blow up the tube, any air that escapes makes a big impact! When floating on it, you can see the air bubbles escaping under water.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: ) and it simply doesn't contain enough air to comfortably buoy your head (let alone your body) above the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with high hopes but literally no one in my family will use it. We have a backyard pool (so no waves!) and it simply doesn't contain enough air to comfortably buoy your head (let alone your body) above the water's surface. Not even my 7 year old, who weighs all of 60 lbs, can get on it without sinking. Last year we had two, more expensive, floats of the same brand that we loved, so this was an extra big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: JosieF

customer_reviews.title: Best float I’ve ever had!
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable and you can lay on your tummy to tan while you stay cool in the water. Loving it on these hot days! The hooks on each side are convenient if you want to Hook something that you don’t want to lose (like a bathing suit top or a little waterproof bag or another float) My first one was a gift from my daughter and I am so glad because I may not have purchased one till I tried it. Worth the money! Doesn’t deflate and I’ve had air in my first one For at least a year and a half or more! I use it year-round!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Fredrickson

customer_reviews.title: Great but may have issues. 3 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great concept we love these, but one of the two we bought ripped along the nylon cover and there is a no return or replace policy. That's why these are three stars. My wife and I took great care of these but one only lasted a little over s month. The worse part is that if you do have a problem you're on your own. So be prepared to spend $25 and end up with a ripped nylon like ours. Otherwise these would be 4 to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it!!
customer_reviews.text: This float blows. You literally have to keep your head out of the water yourself. Very uncomfortable due to neck cramps. Don't do it.
customer_reviews.author: TriciaR3020

customer_reviews.title: besy pool floatie I have found
customer_reviews.text: You can easily fall asleep in these they are so comfortable and if you live in an arid climate where the dry air makes it cold in 120 degrees like Arizona these are perfect because your mostly submerged with just your knees and head exposed. Since the air compartments are small the hammock is completely filled in 4 breaths of air which makes filling easy and they coil up into a 20" disc when not in use and store in the zipper bag. I will probably order a couple more of these for guests.
customer_reviews.author: A. Design

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement. My prior one lasted almost 3 seasons until my adult daughter jumped on it and through it. It’s a comfortable mesh and not strong enough to be jumped on. The mesh allows the water come through and cool you off. You float in the water not on top of it. It’s so comfortable for me. I weigh 155 lbs and have no issues with floatation. At the end of the season I simply deflate it and it folds up into a ring which I store in its’ bag.
customer_reviews.author: jS

customer_reviews.title: Are you ready for a new favorite napping chair!?!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable! It feels pretty unstable when you first get on, but you quickly settle in. This thing is so comfortable, it's now my favorite place to nap! Know that your entire body will be submersed, with just your head and feet above water. Some people may not like that feeling, others will love it. The outer walls do bend a bit (not perfectly round) when you blow it up, but it doesn't seem to effect the performance. I'll update if this does become an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jay F.

customer_reviews.title: My new go-to float
customer_reviews.text: This is my new go-to float for the beach and pool this summer. I had a float like this previously but it had a hole for the feet that ended up stretching and ripping after just a few uses. This one is much better designed and holds up to folding, inflating, and near constant summertime use. I've already had friends ask where they can get one too.
customer_reviews.author: C.F.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Float Bad Valve Design.
customer_reviews.text: Cannot give 5 stars as the air fill valve is very cheaply made. After inflation you are required to use finger to stop air from flowing out. Most inflatables use one-way air valves eliminating backflow of air. Also the valve is designed to retract after filling. This valve would not retract properly. It is on the bottom of the float so no big deal but no 5 star rating due to these two issues. Float is comfortable and easily handles adult swimmers.
customer_reviews.author: crazydz

customer_reviews.title: Quality is nice and I think it will hold up fine
customer_reviews.text: Quality is nice and I think it will hold up fine. My husband, who is 6', fits into it perfectly and enjoys it. The problem is that we bought it for me and at 5'2" it swallows me up! My legs aren't heavy enough to weigh down the rim in front and my head isn't high enough to reach the rim in back, so basically I just end up folded in half and submerged or stretched out stiffly trying to lie balanced on the thing. If there were a children's sized one of these I'm sure I'd love it, as it is, I can't recommend this to my fellow petites!
customer_reviews.author: MSP

customer_reviews.title: Weak buoyancy, pretty flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Cant really say I would recommend this float. Buoyancy is pretty weak so you are really half submerged (I weigh 195) - and I have maximum pressure in both pillow and main chambers. Forget about laying on your stomach, you’ll be drinking water. Construction seems to be holding up well, though I suspect the failure points will be the inflation valves. It’s “ok” and I’ll keep using it it doesn’t even keep my 50 lb dog afloat. I wish I had picked something with more flotation.
customer_reviews.author: Shaino

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what it looks like but not useful
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what it looks like. Easy to set up and inflate as it doesn’t take much air. But it’s not at all comfortable. You can’t sit up without continually engaging your abs and you can’t lie back as there’s no support. We found this to be useless for us and I wouldn’t recommend it. The next models up weren’t available at the time we ordered this but they’re much better and usable.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: I won't return this because it works... but not perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I got the first raft and returned it. The company sent me another one to try. Unfortunately, it has the same flaw: The spring bar around the raft bends inward, creating a taco-like ride. The raft is comfortable but it sure doesn't stay in the shape of a raft... so I float with a crooked raft.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: We needed a replacement for a similar floating hammock that we had for 6(!) years before it broke. Unfortunately this one is very bad quality. It folds in on you when you. We tried blowing it up more and checked for broken parts but it is just a bad design I guess. Since we already used it in the pool we can not send it back. But it really was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Nuja

customer_reviews.title: Works, just wish the rims were noodles instead of inflatable.
customer_reviews.text: I was just a little disappointed when this arrived because I thought the rim was a noodle and not something that needed to be inflated, and could then lose air over time. Inflating it is easy and it works well, I’ve used it 2-3 times with no problems. I don’t know how it will hold up over time, I wish someone would make them with noodle rims but other than that I’m not disappointed with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wendie B

customer_reviews.title: Float your trouble away!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite pool float. Do not get this if you expect to stay dry in the pool- the majority of your body will be in contact with the water, which is perfect for a hot day. My water hammock is on its second year and is still going strong, with just one small hole in the hammock fabric. I haven't had to blow it up once and we are not kind to our pool toys- they are left out all year, not deflated in winter and not kept out of the sun. When I buy another, I will most likely get a water hammock with the sun shade for face.
customer_reviews.author: Abjorkedal

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice But,
customer_reviews.text: We had a previous one (same Brand) that developed a slow leak that I could not find. This one is very nice but not the same quality as the previous one. We like it but when you compare both side by side, there is a visual difference. For example this one envelopes you like you're a hot dog in a bun. The original one was close to 15 years old. Let's see how long this one lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Materials will deteriorate
customer_reviews.text: Although the product itself is great for a limited time it begins to deteriorate rather quickly. I've had mine (4 in total) for just over a year. The mesh on two of them have begun to deteriorate and small holes are appearing. I live in NY so these are not used year long and I store them indoors. I contacted the manufacturer and basically received a response saying tough luck you purchased these over a year ago we won't help you or make things right. Very disappointing to say the least. So if you are in the market for a disposable raft then this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: KrunchTime

customer_reviews.title: Loved it but then it broke. Now I'm sad.
customer_reviews.text: I was singing from the mountaintops about this hammock. Everyone that came over heard me. I know people went out and bought it. But yesterday I got in and the plastic piece around the perimeter broke. I never had any jumping on it, just lay down and relax. I have no way to fix the plastic piece because it is inside the lining so I'm going to have to junk it....bummer. Got like 15 uses out of it and loved every use for sure. It's a really great experience but for some reason it doesn't last long.
customer_reviews.author: CaliDad

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this "float"
customer_reviews.text: Buy this "float" if you want to sink. I bought this float based on the picture of a large dog comfortably laying on it in the ad.. I don't see how they could have gotten a dog onto this float without ripping the very this netting which is the center and most of the "float". I was very disappointed in this product. Will keep it only because I do not want to be bothered with the inconvenience of sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for us, but check the air valve
customer_reviews.text: Bought three of these to replace very similar floats that we'd had for years before they got holes in them. These are the perfect size for the river floating we like to do. Not too big, and I liked that they have a cup holder. Upon receipt, the first thing I did was check the air valves on them as many reviewers had mentioned getting defective ones, and sure enough, one of the three was warped and could not be closed correctly. Otherwise, pretty happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: WorldlyOne

customer_reviews.title: It’s fine not great
customer_reviews.text: Not so thrilled with this product, the wire frame is not so sturdy as another one I had to replace(I don’t have the product name/brand) so I bought this reading is had so many good reviews. The wire frame curls on one side a little and is not sturdy as the other I wanted to replace. No one will sink to the bottom so we use it.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: A step below what I’ve used in past
customer_reviews.text: We return it was substantionally smaller than other brands we had in last and head rest was basically flat so head was resting literally underwater . Maybe for a very small person or child this would work but not full grown adult -! I’m 5,8 do maybe 5,4 and below but don’t plan on it keeping hair dry with head rest in any size
customer_reviews.author: Lori Silverman

customer_reviews.title: So amazing they may get stolen
customer_reviews.text: I love these things, I buy new ones literally every summer because they're perfect. I get the sun but get to stay cool in the water....greatest pool invention ever. Two years ago, I was at a resort in Bahrain and a few kids tried to make off with floating hammocks when I was in the bathroom. It's a small resort so I found them quickly and easily but still... don't look away if you have one, they'll grow legs.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Even tho I chose basic shipping, i received this in less than 24 hours!! I already knew I would like it because I had tried a friend's. I can't blow up a regular innertube, but this I could blow up, doesn't take much air. Opened it, inflated it, put right in pool, perfect! I like this,better than other rafts or floaties bc the mesh "body " allows my body to be in the,water. I get too hot on rafts that hold you above the water. Definitely recommend. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: These are the BEST water chairs!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair to pack in my checked bag for a vacation. It was perfect for that. Just make sure if you plan on bringing it home that you watch carefully as you remove it from the packaging how to twist & return it to its original form :) This brand is absolutely marvelous for comfort. I have 4 of the lounge chairs and love them. The chair is just as comfortable. What I appreciate the most is how little air/blowing up is involved with these. They are amazing and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: So easy to inflate
customer_reviews.text: Whoever designed this thing should get the Nobel Peace Prize. It is genius. So easy to inflate. When you lie on it, it keeps your body buoyant while you are immersed in about an inch or two of water. It is like floating on a cloud. I can't believe I paid the same amount for some crappy bouncy house raft that started leaking in two places after 2 or 3 trips to the pool. If you want to relax in a pool, get one of these - STAT!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect float
customer_reviews.text: This is the best float I've ever had. I'm a very large woman (200 lbs.) and I was totally comfortable in the pool. It's easy to get in and out of. It's great how you sink just enough to have the water cover your bottom and the bottom of your legs. The drink holder on the side works perfectly. It's very well made. I purchased two more for this summer's vacation.
customer_reviews.author: BetteTop Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 summers and could go longer
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had mine for three full summers now (and I’m a very large woman). Finally to the point where I need to replace. But only because the fabric is giving out so the air valve is sliding under the fabric which is annoying only. The air chambers fill and empty easily with no leaks. $26 for three summers in the lake I’d say that’s pretty good!
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Waste Of Money
customer_reviews.text: First time we used it, the nylon ripped along a seam. The nylon is not tight along the blow-up ring. We are not heavy people either which could possibly cause a rip. It is cheaply made or there is no quality control here. For the amount of money paid for this , it was sure a waste. Until this chair is no longer usable we have to treat it with kid gloves (if that is even possible). I forsee this happening in the very near future. Don't waste your money! There are other alternatives (better made) on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Stuff Collector

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for ocean trips!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a frequent beach-goer and was looking for a float that wouldn’t be too bulky to carry... this was exactly what I needed! It folds up nicely, then you just have to blow to inflate the outer blue area and the head rest.... very comfortable! I was able to float on my stomach and back for hours. I weigh around 180. It was a little tricky to get it to fold back up, but I figured it out quickly. Love!
customer_reviews.author: Deidra Church

customer_reviews.title: Best float I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: This beats the vinyl off those cheap plasticky mattress floats you can buy at the big box stores for a couple bucks. I'm a big girl - at 6 ft I'm built like a linebacker, and I was worried that with only the sides and pillow having air to keep me afloat, I'd sink, but I was pleasantly surprised to find myself gently hugged and cradled right at the water line. Unlike with the cheap vinyl floats, I don't have issues tipping off of this hammock, either. I love this! I want to buy a second one for my honey to float on with me.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Tmouh

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold air
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this last summer in August to take to Florida in the winter. Didn’t take it out of box until we arrived. Blew it up to use and it doesn’t hold air. If you purchase check it right away! I can no longer return mine. I purchased a Swimways brand to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Burel

customer_reviews.title: a huge disappointment. I received it on January 5th and I ...
customer_reviews.text: a huge disappointment. I received it on January 5th and I was able to use it on the 27th. when I inflate it I realized that the fabric was cracked, (photo) anyway the air was not lost in that place. I guess it will be punctured on the side edge where the rods are attached internally. really a shame because I pay for it and I will not be able to use it and since I do not live in the USA I can not return it I hope you consider this situation
customer_reviews.author: mercedes

customer_reviews.title: I was going to give this 3 stars but one ...
customer_reviews.text: I was going to give this 3 stars but one of the blow up valves separated from the plastic reinforcement that went around it. So far it is not effecting the air retention. I was surprised it had to be blown up on the outside rim and pillow. I read the description and no where did it say it had to be inflated in any way. I thought I was buying a float with a non inflatable type rim and pillow. So be aware if you don't want something that may leak someday. I have used it once in the pool for a couple hours including kids being rough with it so we will see if it lasts??
customer_reviews.author: becky dangelo

customer_reviews.title: My favorite pool chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pool chair. The back is upright enough to support your neck if you want to read in the pool which I do. Plus my grandkids love it as a little boat that I can push them around in. It actually held both of them with room for some toys as well. I have had mine for 3 seasons now and it still works just fine. No issues with loss or air or leaks. It's really a great chair for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M. Burch

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 lounge pool chairs. Love the one that works but one of the chairs has misshaped and defective air plug so it will not hold air so we requested an exchange. 4/22 I am updating/changing my review to say that the cupholders DO hold beverages well. They hold our 32 ounce Yeti's perfectly!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry6369

customer_reviews.title: The float keeps him upright in the pool and able to enjoy family fun time
customer_reviews.text: Our use of this float is probably different than most. We have a son who is disabled and paralyzed. We found the Kelsyus floating chair and gave it a try for getting our son in the pool. It works perfectly. The float keeps him upright in the pool and able to enjoy family fun time. I would suggest that anyone looking at the product for a person with special needs take time to review the product and test it thoroughly for safety, but it really met our needs
customer_reviews.author: Siglaumo

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Nice and comfortable but hard to shut the valve fast enough without half the air escaping. Got to be super quick with one finger covering the valve opening and the other to push the cap in...and I mean fast. I would recommend this raft as it is very comfortable and nice to have the mesh that allows you to stay wet.
customer_reviews.author: phxmary

customer_reviews.title: good float
customer_reviews.text: I did not think this can keep a person afloat on water, but it does. It's very easy to inflate and takes surprisingly less air and time to inflate. Please note that this float is little different than other floats you have used. You will think that you are going to go down with it, but it does float eventually. Your b-u-t-t remains under water. It's little different but relaxing experience.
customer_reviews.author: Rabit

customer_reviews.title: Eh, okay
customer_reviews.text: I feel that this float is too big for me. I am 5'2 and around 105 pounds. I ended up just putting it back on the beach because it was just in the way. I would literally have to put my arms around the float to keep it from folding. The mesh seat is way too big. I could fit in it in the water. I do think it's good for floating, but if you already know how to float on your back, then you wouldn't need this.
customer_reviews.author: krissy

customer_reviews.title: Kelsyus Floating Water Hammock
customer_reviews.text: This is a great floating water hammock. It well put together and sturdy. It is wide enough for one adult to lay on their back. You should note, you will not completely float above water. Part of your backside will be slightly in the water. That's one of the reasons i purchased this, because that helps you cool off. Great price point, no inflating and comes with a zippered case for transport. Love mine!
customer_reviews.author: sabinesmom

customer_reviews.title: Crooked and cheap
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk! Just look at the picture; it is all crooked and the valves do not hold air, so it is almost impossible to inflate properly by mouth. Even cheap inflatables from china have valves that hold the air while you blow it in, but in this thing as soon as you stop blowing the valves let the air out. I had to use a compressor to inflate it. I should have returned it right away, but hoped that the crookedness would correct itself. What a joke of product.
customer_reviews.author: Jorgetor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Idea and quality product
customer_reviews.text: Most pool toys and floats are so cheaply made you will not get one season from them, but these floating hammocks are truly awesome. They are well built with a durable vinyl liner and thick webbing that is very comfortable. They float well and lying in them you can still get sun. I highly recommend these for your pool. Easy 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. RL

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured, cup holder does not fit a pop can.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these chairs because of the clips shown and the cup holders. The clips/tab on chair to connect them are flimsy and look like they will tear with little pressure. The cup holders in the nylon do not line up with the inflated part and are useless. We bought these to take to the lake. We are now 45 minute drive from nearest store to get floats that will work. Very upset as we have no option to use them and are afraid to tie them together. Cup holder is an issue as well.
customer_reviews.author: TERESA ALDRIDGE

customer_reviews.title: Better for private pool use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this float bc it had good reviews and looked exactly like what I was wanting. However, upon receiving the float, I took it out of the package and realized it had plastic tubing in it. That is what gives it its shape apparently. Well it wouldn’t be convenient to inflate and deflate each trip to the community pool. When it’s opened up it is longer than 5’ so it would be hard to get in and out of the car without having to deflate each time. This float would be perfect if we had our own pool.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Luna

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Used all summer. Supported even my 6’ tall husband. I thought it would be flimsy but it wasn’t. We will be able to use it next year too. Very happy with the quality and the ability to support even big adults.
customer_reviews.author: Scorpica

customer_reviews.title: great compact float.
customer_reviews.text: very happy with the float. Got it for wife to float in ocean on excursions. inflates easy. super supportive with pillow. right size for my 4'9" wife. stores easy when folded. Wish folding directions were more descriptive. took almost ten minutes to fold first time. got easier second and third etc.
customer_reviews.author: campinnh

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but bad valve design
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice float but extremely hard to blow up. As soon as you quit blowing air into it, the air starts leaking out. Not just a little air, but half the air you put in will be gone before you can close the valve.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Positively love these!
customer_reviews.text: Positively love this item. I ordered 3 of them and took them to the Caribbean for 2 weeks. Our one mistake was to not inspect the item before we lugged it on vacation. One item had a tear in it that we didn't notice until we got there and tried to inflate it. Amazon took it back with a refund with no problems. We would highly recommend this item. Hubby and I are larger people, but under the max weight limit, and had no problems with it holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen

customer_reviews.title: It works great if you want to float while being submerged
customer_reviews.text: Neat idea. It works great if you want to float while being submerged. My husband of 230lbs was looking for a chair for the water like this one but I think this needs a bit of a lighter person. That being said, the kids like it. The baby's can stand in it and still be in the water (with supervision of course) it's a good pool float. It doesn't seem to have a air plug when blowing up so when you stop blowing and try to push the plug in you lose a lot of air. That's the only downfall I can tell.
customer_reviews.author: Bonita

customer_reviews.title: Great simple raft!
customer_reviews.text: There are some rafts that you sit on top of and you are not immersed in the water and that is not this raft! This raft keeps you nice and cool on a very hot summer day because your body is immersed in the water while you have the inflated sections on the head rest and the arm area to hold onto. I really like this raft because I like to be kept cool. Solid rafts don't do this.
customer_reviews.author: Sushiyaya

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pool Addition
customer_reviews.text: Really like this "chair" for the pool. The ring around the chair inflated quickly and the chair itself is very comfortable. You don't tip over backwards when you recline which I was afraid of. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: They are very comfortable. A bit difficult to fold up but are ...
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased these chairs a few years now. We leave 2 in Aruba for timeshare use in the lazy river and Caribbean sea and have some at home for pool use. They last several years. They are very comfortable. A bit difficult to fold up but are well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: C L W

customer_reviews.title: Not made well
customer_reviews.text: I have used my float in the pool twice and the fabric is already tearing at the seam. It bubbles when your in the water and you can see a half inch tear. Within 2 more uses it will be useless.
customer_reviews.author: Carly E

customer_reviews.title: not our first
customer_reviews.text: We've bought this model before. Expensive, but, the best float we found for comfort. It lasts about 2-3 seasons with proper care. Not great but, not terrible. It's not a good float for the obese or those over 225 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: sendcash

customer_reviews.title: Fun, light float
customer_reviews.text: Fun, light float. However I have my doubts on how long it will last. Already ripped on the side seam. Hopefully will get a season out of it. Very comfortable but know that it doesn't keep you out of the water if thats what your looking for.
customer_reviews.author: cinRN

customer_reviews.title: Great if they would last more than a month!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 1 and loved it so bought another. The second one leaked out of the box. Returned for another. The replacement split on the outside cover yesterday! 4 days past return expiration! Not a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: MIKEY 650i

customer_reviews.title: Will be buying more...this is the best water floaty ever!
customer_reviews.text: I took this on vacation with me to Dale Hollow Lake. It was amazing. Everyone wanted to use it. It is fully supportive but allowed me to enjoy the water. It folded up fairly easily and fit back in the little bag. All it took was to pop it out of the bag and blow up (just a little bit of air need) the rim and all done.....I will be buying more. This size would be perfect for anyone, adult or child. It was made of very durable material and I absolutely can not say enough good things about it. If you have any specific questions, please feel free to ask.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: BEAT
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this floated. It is by far the best purchase for the beach when we travel. It is light, it is stays cool, it is easy to get on and off, and it folds small enough to fit in your luggage. Best part is that there’s very little inflating to do.
customer_reviews.author: Euridice Leto

customer_reviews.title: Awesome floats!
customer_reviews.text: I love this float. I bought three and my sisters and I can float in my pool and hold a conversation. They feel solid, so hopefully they will last. I've tried the 5.00 plastic float chairs and they rip by the second use. These are very comfortable and you stay cool because you're partly in the water, but not lying flat on your back.
customer_reviews.author: Mpblatte

customer_reviews.title: the customer support was fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a father's day gift for my husband. Didn't try to use it until over a month later on vacation. Didn't even make it to the water - wouldn't hold air. There must've been a leak somewhere but the nylon over the top of the vinyl tube, kept us from finding it. We were able to buy a similar float to use at a local store. By the time we returned home from vacation, the amazon return window had closed. But talked to customer support and was able to get a full refund. While we weren't thrilled with the product, the customer support was fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: LCady

customer_reviews.title: Great float & I’ve tried many.
customer_reviews.text: This float is great! Very east to inflate, very portable, very buoyant & comfortable. I bought it to take to the marina to float & to take on our boat to float while we’re anchored. Perfect for all of this. I like it so much I’m ordering another one for my pool at home.
customer_reviews.author: Gaynell S.

customer_reviews.title: Yes, the best!
customer_reviews.text: The legit floating hammock. If it is hot out, this is a must. You will never got back to another inflatable air mattress. PROS: -keeps you cool -comfortable -easy to blow up -durable CONS: -holds water quite a bit- takes a little while to drain after long use. Not a deal breaker for me though!
customer_reviews.author: Smokey

customer_reviews.title: It came with a small hole and we would have ...
customer_reviews.text: It came with a small hole and we would have to blow it up each day. Unfortunately this was not found until we were using it the next day. Had to throw away after 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used and moldy
customer_reviews.text: This product was supposed to be new. It is not. It has very obviously been used before. The valve to blow it up is filled with pieces of leaves and what I think is mold. I'm annoyed to say the least. We've had the infant version of this float, so I'm sure the float itself is great... this seller, not so much!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Such great potential stalled by a simple flaw.
customer_reviews.text: I'm frustrated at how many of these have been damaged by simple standard use. They tear at the seam that goes around the flexible metal around the outside and the rip will keep getting bigger and bigger until the inflatable part comes out and it cant be used anymore. That being said, I have probably bought 3 of these and I keep buying them because they are so comfortable and fun.
customer_reviews.author: DARWIN MATTHEWS

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Second purchase of this float, had the first one for well over 10 years! Finally needed to upgrade it! They are so easy to inflate, hold you comfortably in the water, and store easily, love this float!
customer_reviews.author: Janalyzer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and good value
customer_reviews.text: Love the comfort and security of these floats and the added feature of being able to link them together makes for good times and great conversation while floating in the water! They don't take up much room in the boathouse even when ring is inflated.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Too comfortable...
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to relax in this floating hammock. Almost too easy, my husband fell asleep in it in the pool and wound up very sunburnt. Despite his sunburn he was in it again the next day, slathered in spf 50. Would recommend this product as a more sensible, adult pool floatie. Sure it isn't shaped like a pizza or a flamingo, but are pizzas or flamingos comfortable? No. Hammocks? Yesssss.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all
customer_reviews.text: Not too good, after a couple of uses the head section stop working and after that a time a wire pop on a side. Bottom line, in less than 2 weeks I have to put it in the garbage
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best way to stay cool
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a mesh float in my local stores all summer and none of them had one that wasn't a recliner so I eventually gave up and ordered it on here. I am so glad I did. The float is very easy to blow up and put away and so comfortable in the water. I can sit on it, lay on it, use it as a floatie, all while staying partially in the water and therefore cooler.
customer_reviews.author: MaryBeth

customer_reviews.title: Air plug broke after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this item for the short time that it worked. I took it to Aruba and used it in the ocean for lounging. The plastic plug that seals the air hole no longer fit inside the plastic portion. It had become too loose. I ended up cutting the plug off and MacGyvering a contraption to keep it sealed. I ended up throwing it away in Aruba since the plug had broken.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hammock for a friend of mine. She already had a favorite "floatie matt" so she didn't think this one would get much use. After considering it, she decided to keep it for when company comes over. So she decided to try it out. Now this is her go-to matt. She loves that she's actually IN the water instead of ON the water. It keeps her cool and refreshed and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Howard

customer_reviews.title: Blowing up is annoying
customer_reviews.text: The moment you remove the pump or your mouth from the nozzle for blow up, all the air comes back out. You have to strategically place your tongue against the nozzle and be ready to cap it shut immediately. It took several tries. Other than that it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Love this float!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this float! It inflates and deflated in under 5 seconds. After buying one for myself I had to buy for the rest of my family because they kept asking to borrow it
customer_reviews.author: Matt M

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Very displeased with quality. After 2-1/2 months of maybe 1 time a week gentle adult use, the fabric has split. Very hard to inflate. Return window has of course closed. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Gerri K

customer_reviews.title: You will love them
customer_reviews.text: These are the best. Easy to store, easy to use and best of all holds my fat b--t up. These are perfect to float around in and be cooled by the water surrounding you. Yes you will get wet but it is not one of those hard foam mats that are uncomfortable to lay on. These feel great and are so relaxing. The grandkids fight on them and they have held up so far with no problems. Mine are in great shape and will be used again this summer. More than I can say for most of the other pool items I had.
customer_reviews.author: HPDretired

customer_reviews.title: Nice floating hammock
customer_reviews.text: Nice floating hammock, it even holds my 200 pound self. I will say don't forget to fill the part up with air. Made that mistake and was sinking until I figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: JApurch

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this float for my husband, and he really liked it for the two short times that he got to use it. It stopped holding air & there is no way to fix it. It was adult owned and used in our swimming pool with care. Totally not worth the money & couldn't return because by the time we realized it would no longer hold air too much time had passed.
customer_reviews.author: Beth A.

customer_reviews.title: Own FIVE of these
customer_reviews.text: We have bought six of these over the last five years, and only one has had to be retired. We keep two in our beach bag, two in our boat bag, and one in our Sea-Doo. They are the PERFECT packable water seat and keep you in the perfect orientation to talk with friends or ignore your family offshore for hours. Every time they are used, people see them and go buy some themselves. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Scribe

customer_reviews.title: My husband will fight you for it!
customer_reviews.text: Suspends you like a hammock, but your body floats in the water keeping you cool during hot days. My husband called dibs on it right away, and he says that after floating around for a while, he is so relaxed he can hardly walk out of the pool. Very relaxing! Be extremely careful when inflating because it does not take much air, and pillow area will rip if over inflated. It is a "hammock," and not your typical float.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Bonnie Serrett

customer_reviews.title: Good Float
customer_reviews.text: Your body will be below the water but perfect for tanning on a hot sunny day. Tricky to inflate, gotta be quick. Did fade in the sun but not a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: K Thibodeaux

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the lake.
customer_reviews.text: I totally love this thing. I take it to the lake and it's so easy to pack, carry, and inflate. It's super comfortable and you can adjust how you sit in it to float higher or lower. I could almost fall asleep in it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Phillippi

customer_reviews.title: Looked just like one we bought in 2014 that lasted 2 seasons
customer_reviews.text: Looked just like one we bought in 2014 that lasted 2 seasons. This one had a large scratch along one side but would not impact the floating, etc. so we decided to keep it; a mistake on our part. The scratch is fraying now and we can start to see the inner parts of the raft. The mesh also has split open and now we have 2 small tears that are growing with each use. I would not recommend this/buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Y. from Houston

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Rides really low in the water. I only weigh 150 and most of my body was in / under the water. Broke the first time we took it to the lake. The main air bladder slowly started leaking. Since beverages were being consumed, i did not notice immediatly. Right about the time my nose got to the water line, it got my attention... Since i don't have the packaging i can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Conti

customer_reviews.title: QualityReusable and easy to transport!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the sturdiness of the floats, the backrest, the cup holder and the ability to hook our floats together. My friend who directed me to this product was jealous of the carrying case that it comes in. Hers did not. Would suggest that directions to repackage include a directive to spin/coil it to a smaller circumference that will fit into the case. My husband struggled at that point and was frustrated. I observed him and tried that approach and it worked immediately. Others at the resort, both at the beach and the lazy river were asking us about our floats. They had purchased flimsy vinyl.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Good to sit in the pool!
customer_reviews.text: I would have liked a little more support in the back and/or to sit up a little bit higher, but it's comfortable and nice to have. It's held up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT FOLD UP AS SHOWN
customer_reviews.text: This comes folded up in a round circle in a plastic bag with a zipper, once removed from the package . .. good luck getting it folded up again. The packaging shows it as an easy two step flip, flip. NOT THE CASE! If you are looking at buying this because you think it will be easy to store, think again. I will say it blows up fast and deflates fast and is realatively comfortable to sit in.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd Kelsyus float of this kind. The first we bought 2-3 years ago and has survived lots of use, but the fabric is finally starting to tear. We wasted *lots* of money on cheap Wal**rt floats only to have them tear on first use. Better to spend money on a quality product once than waste it on disposable junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replacement needed
customer_reviews.text: Thi ssd's had a hole in it within a day. Cant return it...no box. Want a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: izzy

product_meta.title: Kelsyus Floating Hammock
product_meta.description: The Kelsyus Float-A-Round is a durable fabric-covered floating chair perfect for adventurers on the go! The soft, cooling mesh seat comfortably suspends your body below the water's surface, while the inflatable outer ring supports your head and arms as you drift along. The patented inner spring around the outside edge of the pool float provides greater comfort and stability in the water. When you are ready to go, this float folds flat into three compact circles for easy portability and storage. When folded, the Float-A-Round easily fits into most carry-on luggage making this float a great choice for travel and weekend getaways! Use the side clips to create your own flotilla with other Kelsyus float products, or to tether the float to your boat or dock when you want to float in place. Approximate dimensions (when fully inflated): 36 in x 35.5 in x 2.5 in. Carry bag included. Supports adults up to 250 pounds. Sold individually.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
